params.name: ordersWithFulfillments
params.doc: List of order IDs and their associated fulfillments' info.

docs.summary: Creates multiple fulfillments for one or more orders.
description:
The `bulkCreateFulfillments()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the fulfillments are created.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: Create a fulfillment for 2 different orders

description:
The `createFulfillment()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the fulfillment is created.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

extra.description: By passing a supported `shippingProvider`, the `trackingLink` field is auto-populated in the response

description:
The `deleteFulfillment()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the fulfillment is deleted.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

params.name: orderIds
params.doc: List of order IDs for which to retrieve fulfillments.

docs.summary: Retrieves fulfillments associated with multiple specified orders.
description: The `listFulfillmentsForMultipleOrders()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the fulfillments are retrieved.

params.name: orderId
params.doc: Order ID for which to retrieve fulfillments.

docs.summary: Retrieves fulfillments associated with a specified order.
description: The `listFulfillmentsForSingleOrder()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the fulfillments are retrieved.

params.name: identifiers
params.doc: Order and fulfillment IDs to be updated.

params.name: options
params.doc: Available options to use when updating a fulfillment.

ret.doc: Order ID and the orders' associated fulfillments after update.

docs.summary:
Updates a fulfillment's properties.
To update a field's value, include the new value in the `fulfillment` field in the body params.
To remove a field's value, pass `null`.
description:
The `updateFulfillment()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the fulfillment is updated.

> **Note:** Updating line item IDs or fulfilled quantities is not allowed. To update line item IDs or quantities, delete the fulfillment and create it again.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: ordersWithFulfillments
members.doc: List of order IDs and their associated fulfillments' info.

members.name: ordersWithFulfillments
members.doc: List of order IDs and their associated fulfillments.

members.name: orderWithFulfillments
members.doc: Order ID and the orders' fulfillments.

members.name: fieldsData
members.doc: Custom fulfillment info in key:value form.

members.name: fulfillmentId
members.doc: ID of the fulfillment to delete.

members.name: fulfillmentId
members.doc: ID of the fulfillment to delete.

members.name: orderWithFulfillments
members.doc: Order ID and the order's associated fulfillments after deletion.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Fulfillment creation date and time in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

description: for now, this is a sub-object of Orders, so can refer to order line items by id.

members.name: fulfillmentId
members.doc: ID of the newly created fulfillment.

members.name: orderId
members.doc: Order ID (auto generated upon order creation).

members.name: orderId
members.doc: Order ID (auto generated upon order creation).

members.name: _id
members.doc: Line item ID (mirrors the ID of the order line item).

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Line item quantity.
* If this property isn't passed on creation, it defaults to the number of items not already linked to a fulfillment.
* If the order does not have the requested quantity of line items available to add to this fulfillment, the fulfillment will not be created and an error is returned.

Min: `1`
Max: `100000`

members.name: shippingProvider
members.doc:
Shipping provider. Using one of the following shipping providers will allow for auto-filling the tracking link:
* `'fedex'`
* `'ups'`
* `'usps'`
* `'dhl'`
* `'canadaPost'`

members.name: trackingLink
members.doc: Tracking link. Auto-filled if a predefined shipping provider is used, otherwise provided on creation.

members.name: orderId
members.doc: Order ID (auto generated upon order creation).

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: orderIds
members.doc: List of order IDs for which to retrieve fulfillments.

members.doc: List of order IDs and their associated fulfillments.

members.doc: Order ID for which to retrieve fulfillments.

members.name: orderWithFulfillments
members.doc: List of fulfillments associated with the order.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Fulfillment creation date and time in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

Shipping provider. Using the following shipping providers will allow for autofilling the tracking link:
* `fedex`
* `ups`

* `canadaPost`
